content: AKSearch this siteEmbedded FilesSkip to main contentSkip to navigationAkash KumarI am a James R. Isaac Chair Assistant Professor at IIT Bombay in the Computer Science Department.  Earlier, I did a postdoc at EPFL hosted by Prof. Michael Kapralov. Even earlier, I did my PhD under the superb guidance of Prof Saugata Basu at Purdue.  My research interests lie in the fields of Property Testing, Spectral Graph Theory and Recovery of Planted Structures in Graphs. Even earlier, I did my Masters in Computer Science at Georgia Institute of Technology where I specialized in Theoretical CS. If you have questions or comments and think you are not a bot, please feel free to drop me an email at <my first name> [at] cse.iitb.ac.in. I am one of the co-editors of the PTReview blog.Students Mentored:So far, I have been very fortunate to work with Agastya Jha, a Masters Student at EPFL.
